oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Soldiers climbing aboard a truck

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Six soldiers preparing to depart on a truck for patrol, photographed from behind the truck bed. One soldier is pointing to or reaching for his rifle. The truck is probably a "deuce and a half," slang for a two-and-a-half-ton truck. The photograph is from Ammons's first tour in 1968.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Men; Soldiers; Military vehicles; Trucks; Military uniforms; Military personnel
Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; United States. Army. Infantry Division, 1st; Vehicles, Military
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia, on April 18, 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970. His photographs show details of the daily life of soldiers in Vietnam.
